result.execSummary:
The defendant Camilo Chavez Barron was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: 60 days to pay or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts

ADDRESS INFO for Camilo Chavez Barron
Current: 5445 Cty Tk W  #14, Pine Grove Villa, Bancroft, WI 54921   (Effective: 01-25-2016)
Prior: 5445 Cty Tk W  #14, Bancroft, WI 54921

Defendant Camilo Chavez Barron in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Interpreter Soria is also present.

10:02 AM Court calls case.
Court states appearances.

10:03 AM Clerk administers Oath of Interpreter to Mr. Soria.

There is a plea agreement.
Defendant will plead to Count 2.
Count 1 will be dismissed and read in.
State recommends fine and costs, this is a joint recommendation.
Restitution of $200 has been paid in full.

Atty Drengler concurs.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.

Defendant enters a plea of: GUILTY Count 2.

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney Drengler for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court finds the defendant guilty.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.
Count 1: Dismissed and Read In
Count 2: Found Guilty

Atty Hess makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
State has complied with victim notification statutes.
Atty Drengler makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 

Court finds joint recommendation is appropriate.

BY THE COURT:
Count 2:
Pay a fine of $150 plus costs
60 days to pay or set up payment plan with the Clerk of Courts
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 22, 2017 at 10:00 am. (Enrique Soria will be present to interpret)
Plea/sentencing hearing on December 15, 2016 at 03:30 pm.
Pre-trial conference on October 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.

Pre-Trial conference set for October 10, 2016.

BY THE COURT:
Hearing re-scheduled.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 10, 2016 at 09:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 16, 2016 at 08:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on August 22, 2016 at 09:45 am.

Defendant Camilo Chavez Barron in court. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  BTC: Warrant quashed and bond set.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
